On 18.11.2010 05:13, Eric J. Bowman wrote:
> Suresh Kumar wrote:
>  >
>  > Thanks everybody. I take the short answer to be "Yes" it is okay to
>  > POST with empty content and I wouldn't be violating HTTP or REST.
>  >
>
> Actually, no, the short answer is the REST constraint, "manipulation of
> resources through representations." Not having an entity doesn't
> necessarily mean not having a representation, but that's what it
> usually means. If you don't have a representation, you don't have
> REST, you have RMI.

It depends.

An empty entity can be a representation.

Best regards, Julian
